title: The Pickled Haitian Condiment Adorning Dishes Across the U.S.
description: Plus: zodiac necklaces, painted lampshades and more recommendations from T Magazine.
media:credit: Left: Eva Kosmas Flores. Right: Randy Schmidt
media:description: Left: chef Gregory Gourdetâ€™s pikliz, the ubiquitous Haitian quick pickle condiment, is made with habanero at his restaurant Kann, in Portland, Ore. Traditional recipes call for Scotch bonnets, which are hard to find in the Pacific Northwest, and habaneros deliver a similar, fruity heat. Right: pikliz adds a tart crunch to braised ribs at the Pan-Caribbean restaurant Cane & Table in New Orleans.
